yeezus.driver

Class Driver

  • java.lang.Object
    • yeezus.driver.Driver

  • public class Driver
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the CPU Driver within the yeezus operating system. Multiple instances of this class indicate the presence of multiple logical CPUs. To initialize the class, the Loader must be called using the static loadFile(Memory, File) method to load the contents of the Program-File.txt to the virtual disk.
    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Mark Zeagler

      Constructs a new Driver instance from the given parameters.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Driver

        public Driver(int numCPUs,
              @NotNull
              Memory disk,
              int registerSize,
              int cacheSize,
              int ramSize,
              @NotNull
              CPUSchedulingPolicy schedulingPolicy)
       throws yeezus.driver.UninitializedDriverException,
              DuplicateIDException,
              InvalidWordException
        Constructs a new Driver instance from the given parameters.
        Parameters:
        numCPUs - The number of CPUs to be used in this system.
        disk - The disk that stores all of the programs to be run by the system.
        registerSize - The the amount of registers that are associated with this driver's CPU.
        cacheSize - The size of the cache to be used by the associated CPU.
        ramSize - The size of the cache to be used by the OS.
        schedulingPolicy - The process scheduling policy that this system will adhere to.
        Throws:
        UninitializedDriverException - Thrown if a driver instance is created before the loader has been run. This can be fixed by running loadFile(Memory, File) prior to creating a Driver instance.
        DuplicateIDException - Thrown if the given CPU ID already exists with another CPU.
        InvalidWordException

    • Method Detail

      • loadFile

        public static void loadFile(Memory disk,
                            java.io.File programFile)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        This loads a file onto the disk in preparation for the creation of Dispatcher instances which will load and execute the programs contained in the file.
        Parameters:
        disk - The disk onto which the contents of the programFile will be loaded.
        programFile - The file whose contents will be loaded onto the disk.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Thrown if there is an issue while loading the file.

      • reset

        public static void reset()
        Resets the Driver after testing.

      • getIdleTimes

        public long[] getIdleTimes()

      • getExecuteTimes

        public long[] getExecuteTimes()

      • run

        public void run()
         throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Executes the main loop of the driver. This loop will run until all processes have been completed, and the process data has been written back to the disk.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - See InterruptedException.

      • dumpData

        public void dumpData()
        Prints a dump of the data that contains the current state of the system. This will print to the System.out PrintStream.
